00001 # Tweepy
00002 # Copyright 2009-2010 Joshua Roesslein
00003 # See LICENSE for details.
00004 
00005 import httplib
00006 import urllib
00007 import time
00008 import re
00009 
00010 from tweepy.error import TweepError
00011 from tweepy.utils import convert_to_utf8_str
00012 from tweepy.models import Model
00013 
00014 re_path_template = re.compile('{\w+}')
00015 
00016 
00017 def bind_api(**config):
00018 
00019     class APIMethod(object):
00020 
00021         path = config['path']
00022         payload_type = config.get('payload_type', None)
00023         payload_list = config.get('payload_list', False)
00024         allowed_param = config.get('allowed_param', [])
00025         method = config.get('method', 'GET')
00026         require_auth = config.get('require_auth', False)
00027         search_api = config.get('search_api', False)
00028         use_cache = config.get('use_cache', True)
00029 
00030         def __init__(self, api, args, kargs):
00031             # If authentication is required and no credentials
00032             # are provided, throw an error.
00033             if self.require_auth and not api.auth:
00034                 raise TweepError('Authentication required!')
00035 
00036             self.api = api
00037             self.post_data = kargs.pop('post_data', None)
00038             self.retry_count = kargs.pop('retry_count', api.retry_count)
00039             self.retry_delay = kargs.pop('retry_delay', api.retry_delay)
00040             self.retry_errors = kargs.pop('retry_errors', api.retry_errors)
00041             self.headers = kargs.pop('headers', {})
00042             self.build_parameters(args, kargs)
00043 
00044             # Pick correct URL root to use
00045             if self.search_api:
00046                 self.api_root = api.search_root
00047             else:
00048                 self.api_root = api.api_root
00049 
00050             # Perform any path variable substitution
00051             self.build_path()
00052 
00053             if api.secure:
00054                 self.scheme = 'https://'
00055             else:
00056                 self.scheme = 'http://'
00057 
00058             if self.search_api:
00059                 self.host = api.search_host
00060             else:
00061                 self.host = api.host
00062 
00063             # Manually set Host header to fix an issue in python 2.5
00064             # or older where Host is set including the 443 port.
00065             # This causes Twitter to issue 301 redirect.
00066             # See Issue https://github.com/tweepy/tweepy/issues/12
00067             self.headers['Host'] = self.host
00068 
00069         def build_parameters(self, args, kargs):
00070             self.parameters = {}
00071             for idx, arg in enumerate(args):
00072                 if arg is None:
00073                     continue
00074 
00075                 try:
00076                     self.parameters[self.allowed_param[idx]] = convert_to_utf8_str(arg)
00077                 except IndexError:
00078                     raise TweepError('Too many parameters supplied!')
00079 
00080             for k, arg in kargs.items():
00081                 if arg is None:
00082                     continue
00083                 if k in self.parameters:
00084                     raise TweepError('Multiple values for parameter %s supplied!' % k)
00085 
00086                 self.parameters[k] = convert_to_utf8_str(arg)
00087 
00088         def build_path(self):
00089             for variable in re_path_template.findall(self.path):
00090                 name = variable.strip('{}')
00091 
00092                 if name == 'user' and 'user' not in self.parameters and self.api.auth:
00093                     # No 'user' parameter provided, fetch it from Auth instead.
00094                     value = self.api.auth.get_username()
00095                 else:
00096                     try:
00097                         value = urllib.quote(self.parameters[name])
00098                     except KeyError:
00099                         raise TweepError('No parameter value found for path variable: %s' % name)
00100                     del self.parameters[name]
00101 
00102                 self.path = self.path.replace(variable, value)
00103 
00104         def execute(self):
00105             # Build the request URL
00106             url = self.api_root + self.path
00107             if len(self.parameters):
00108                 url = '%s?%s' % (url, urllib.urlencode(self.parameters))
00109 
00110             # Query the cache if one is available
00111             # and this request uses a GET method.
00112             if self.use_cache and self.api.cache and self.method == 'GET':
00113                 cache_result = self.api.cache.get(url)
00114                 # if cache result found and not expired, return it
00115                 if cache_result:
00116                     # must restore api reference
00117                     if isinstance(cache_result, list):
00118                         for result in cache_result:
00119                             if isinstance(result, Model):
00120                                 result._api = self.api
00121                     else:
00122                         if isinstance(cache_result, Model):
00123                             cache_result._api = self.api
00124                     return cache_result
00125 
00126             # Continue attempting request until successful
00127             # or maximum number of retries is reached.
00128             retries_performed = 0
00129             while retries_performed < self.retry_count + 1:
00130                 # Open connection
00131                 # FIXME: add timeout
00132                 if self.api.secure:
00133                     conn = httplib.HTTPSConnection(self.host)
00134                 else:
00135                     conn = httplib.HTTPConnection(self.host)
00136 
00137                 # Apply authentication
00138                 if self.api.auth:
00139                     self.api.auth.apply_auth(
00140                             self.scheme + self.host + url,
00141                             self.method, self.headers, self.parameters
00142                     )
00143 
00144                 # Execute request
00145                 try:
00146                     conn.request(self.method, url, headers=self.headers, body=self.post_data)
00147                     resp = conn.getresponse()
00148                 except Exception, e:
00149                     raise TweepError('Failed to send request: %s' % e)
00150 
00151                 # Exit request loop if non-retry error code
00152                 if self.retry_errors:
00153                     if resp.status not in self.retry_errors: break
00154                 else:
00155                     if resp.status == 200: break
00156 
00157                 # Sleep before retrying request again
00158                 time.sleep(self.retry_delay)
00159                 retries_performed += 1
00160 
00161             # If an error was returned, throw an exception
00162             self.api.last_response = resp
00163             if resp.status != 200:
00164                 try:
00165                     error_msg = self.api.parser.parse_error(resp.read())
00166                 except Exception:
00167                     error_msg = "Twitter error response: status code = %s" % resp.status
00168                 raise TweepError(error_msg, resp)
00169 
00170             # Parse the response payload
00171             result = self.api.parser.parse(self, resp.read())
00172 
00173             conn.close()
00174 
00175             # Store result into cache if one is available.
00176             if self.use_cache and self.api.cache and self.method == 'GET' and result:
00177                 self.api.cache.store(url, result)
00178 
00179             return result
00180 
00181 
00182     def _call(api, *args, **kargs):
00183 
00184         method = APIMethod(api, args, kargs)
00185         return method.execute()
00186 
00187 
00188     # Set pagination mode
00189     if 'cursor' in APIMethod.allowed_param:
00190         _call.pagination_mode = 'cursor'
00191     elif 'page' in APIMethod.allowed_param:
00192         _call.pagination_mode = 'page'
00193 
00194     return _call
